365,Fine Particulate Matter (PM2.5),Mean,

Air samples collected at specific NYCCAS monitoring sites along with information about emissions sources were incorporated into a statistical model that predicted pollutant concentrations at all locations in NYC for the specified time period. The results were then assigned to the appropriate NYC neighborhood and averaged. In NYC
column2:
fine particulate matter is measured in units of micrograms per cubic meter of air.

155,Asthma Hospitalizations (Children 0 to 4 Yrs Old),Rate,

Number of asthma-related hospitalizations among NYC resident children up to 4 years old
column2: divided by the population of children up to 4 years old

column1: A hospitalization is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1
column2: 2015. Because the ICD systems are similar in how they classify childhood asthma
column3: data can be compared across years.

159,Asthma Hospitalizations (Youths and Adults),Rate,

Number of asthma-related hospitalizations among NYC resident youths and adults (15 years and older)
column2: divided by the population of youth and adults (15 years and older) using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates

column1: An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1
column2: 2015. <strong style="color: red
column3:
> Because the ICD systems differ in how they classify adult asthma; data are not comparable before and after 2015. Data from 2015 are not shown because they contain a combination of ICD-9 and ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 158,Asthma Hospitalizations (Youths and Adults),Number,

Number of asthma-related hospitalizations among NYC resident youths and adults (15 years and older).

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015.
column4:
> Because the ICD systems differ in how they classify adult asthma; data are not comparable before and after 2015. Data from 2015 are not shown because they contain a combination of ICD-9 and ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 160,Asthma Hospitalizations (Youths and Adults),Age-Adjusted Rate,

Number of asthma-related hospitalizations among NYC resident youths and adults (15 years and older) summed within 5-year age groups; and divided by the population in each age group; using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; quotients are multiplied by the proportion of the 2000 US population in each age group. Age-adjusted rate is the sum of the weighted age-specific rates; expressed as cases per 10;000 residents.

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015.
column5:
> Because the ICD systems differ in how they classify adult asthma; data are not comparable before and after 2015. Data from 2015 are not shown because they contain a combination of ICD-9 and ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 455,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Children 5 to 14 Yrs Old),Rate,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident children aged 5 to 14 years; divided by the population of children 5 to 14 years old; using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; expressed as cases per 10;000 residents.

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015. Because the ICD systems are similar in how they classify childhood asthma; data can be compared across years.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 452,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Children 5 to 14 Yrs Old),Number,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident children aged 5 to 14 years.

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015. Because the ICD systems are similar in how they classify childhood asthma; data can be compared across years.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 456,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Youths and Adults),Rate,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident youths and adults (15 years and older); divided by the population of youth and adults (15 years and older) using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; expressed as cases per 10;000 residents. 

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015. Because the ICD systems differ in how they classify adult asthma; data are not comparable before and after 2015. Data from 2015 are not shown because they contain a combination of ICD-9 and ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 453,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Youths and Adults),Number,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident youths and adults (15 years and older). 

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015. Because the ICD systems differ in how they classify adult asthma; data are not comparable before and after 2015. Data from 2015 are not shown because they contain a combination of ICD-9 and ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 457,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Youths and Adults),Age-Adjusted Rate,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident youths and adults (15 years and older) summed within 5-year age groups; and divided by the population in each age group; using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; quotients are multiplied by the proportion of the 2000 US population in each age group. Age-adjusted rate is the sum of the weighted age-specific rates; expressed as cases per 10;000 residents. 

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015.
column6:
> Because the ICD systems differ in how they classify adult asthma; data are not comparable before and after 2015. Data from 2015 are not shown because they contain a combination of ICD-9 and ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 460,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Children 0 to 4 Yrs Old),Rate,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident children up to 4 years old; divided by the population of children up to 4 years old; using NYC DOHMH intercensal estimates; expressed as cases per 10;000 residents.

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015. Because the ICD systems are similar in how they classify childhood asthma; data can be compared across years.

 

,NYS SPARCS Hospitalization,New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data, 459,Asthma Emergency Department Visits (Children 0 to 4 Yrs Old),Number,

Number of asthma-related emergency department (ED) visits among NYC resident children up to 4 years old. 

 

An ED visit is included if it has an ICD-9 principal diagnosis code of 493 or an ICD-10 principal diagnosis code of J45. New York hospitals began using the ICD-10 system on October 1; 2015.
